blocks.value: St. Vitus (also known as St. Guy) was a Christian martyr who lived in the early 4th century. According to tradition, he was the son of a pagan senator in Sicily. Vitus was raised as a Christian by his nurse and her husband. His father tried to make him renounce his faith, but Vitus refused.

An angel led Vitus, along with his nurse Crescentia and her husband Modestus, away from Sicily to safety. However, they were eventually arrested during the Diocletian persecution. They were tortured but miraculously survived. According to tradition, Vitus was thrown into a cauldron of boiling oil but emerged unharmed. He was eventually martyred at a young age, possibly around 12 years old.

St. Vitus is one of the Fourteen Holy Helpers, a group of saints invoked for their powerful intercession. He is the patron saint of actors, comedians, dancers, and those suffering from epilepsy and nervous disorders. "St. Vitus Dance" is an old name for a neurological disorder.
